CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01A02

TI_TEXT.P: Услуги по поддържане на други зелени площи

TITLE.P: Framework Agreement for Ground Works to Falkirk Council Housing Properties

SHORT_DESCR.P: Four year framework agreement for the provision Ground Labouring and Brick Works, both Labour Works and Materials, to Falkirk Council Housing Properties, as part of the on-going Building Maintenance Division (BMD) Contracts Section contractual programme.
The works will include but is not limited to:

Brick walls, Tar paths, Foundations, Stone chips, Concrete steps and edgings, Hedge and Fence removal, Excavations (for driveways), Landscaping, Reduction of ground level, Brick and slab ramps, Slabbing work, Block and pavior repair, Removal and refit of metal ramps, CAT scanning.

MAIN_SITE.P: With the Falkirk Council area of operation.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Falkirk Council manages and maintains approximately 16 000 housing properties in the Falkirk Council area.

Overall contract value is estimated as 5 500 000 GBP. Falkirk Council is committed to improving the housing stock throughout the Falkirk Council area of operations whilst still maintaining the services to high levels of Best Value principals. Falkirk Council expects that our housing stock will meet the EESSH (Energy Efficiency Standard for Social Housing) by 2020.

Ground Works to Council Housing properties within the Falkirk Council area of operation as part of the on-going Building Maintenance Division (BMD) Contracts Section contractual programme. The framework is for the provision Ground Labouring and Brick Works, both Labour Works and Materials.

The works will include but is not limited to Brick walls, Tar paths, Foundations, Stone chips, Concrete steps and edgings, Hedge and Fence removal, Excavations (for driveways), Landscaping, Reduction of ground level, Brick and slab ramps, Slabbing work, Block and pavior repair, Removal and refit of metal ramps, CAT scanning to locate underground non-metallic pipes, cabling, utilities, ducts and avoidance thereof.

AC_QUALITY.AC_CRITERION: A) Timescale Management, Management of Agreement, Quality Assurance, Risk Management and HAVS Policy
B) Employment Practices and Workforce Matters

INFO_ADD.P: Lotting is not applicable to this tender process, due to the complexity of contract management involving co-ordinating multiple works disciplines within a programme of works. Multiple contractors for this element would impact the ability to effectively co-ordinate multiple requirements into a programme of works.

SUITABILITY.P: It is a requirement of this tender that if the bidder is UK based they must hold a valid registration with Companies House. Where the bidder is UK based but not registered at Companies House they must be able to verify to the Council’s satisfaction that they are trading from the address provided in the tender and under the Company name given.

Bidders will provide evidence of relevant qualifications / experience for all operatives undertaking Ground Labouring and Brick Labour Works, including Sub-contractors, to the Authority with their tender submission.
Contractor's personnel in charge of the management and supervision of works being provided must be suitably qualified and experienced.

The Bidder will provide the relevant certification that all Ground Works operatives proposed to be undertaking works, including Sub-contractors, have undertaken Asbestos Awareness Training, to the Authority with their tender bid.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: The Selection Criteria is outlined in the appendix ESPD document:
Bidders will be required to state the annual turnover of the bidding entity for the last 3 years (ESPD 4B.1.1).
Where turnover information is not available for the time period requested, the bidder will be required to state the date on which they were set up / started trading.

A Creditsafe credit scoring check will be ran on registered Company Name and Company Number provided by the bidder. Where the resulting Credit Rating Score is less than 30/100, the Bidder may be excluded from the tender process unless suitable financial information is provided that give satisfactory assurances to the Council regarding financial risk in appointing the bidder to the proposed Framework.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: Public Contracts Regulations 2015 state that before awarding the contract, the contracting authority shall require the tenderer(s) to submit up to date supporting documents. This includes the insurance requirements stated in ESPD Standardised Statements (4B.5):

Professional Indemnity Insurance = 1 000 000 GBP. Professional Indemnity Insurance is correctly required for agreements / contracts where advice or works such as those involved in Groundworks is provided. A 6-year run off policy is required.
Contract Works Insurance = this is required. Bidders will require to confirm the level of Contract Works Insurance already held, or level they can commit to obtain.
Economic operators may be excluded from this competition if they are in any of the situations referred to in regulation 58 of the Public Contracts (Scotland) Regulations 2015.
Bidders who do not meet the criteria above may be excluded from further participation in this procurement exercise.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: The bidder must hold a UKAS (or equivalent) accredited independent third party certificate of compliance in accordance with BS OHSAS 18001 (or equivalent) or have within the last 12 months successfully met the assessment requirements of a construction – related scheme in registered membership of the Safety Schemes in Procurement (SSIP) forum OR provide responses in relation to 4D.1.4a through to m in the Appendix ESPD (Scotland) Standard Statements v1.9.
Any recorded fail shall result in your submission being non compliant and excluded from the process.

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_MIN_LEVEL.P: For details of any relevant weighted scoring methodology elements for ESPD Section 4c and for ITT Award Criteria, including how each individual element is scored please refer to Non pricing assessment scoring methodology within ITT documentation.
Exclusion: Economic Operators are required to complete and submit the SOCG / Criminal Activity declaration and may be excluded from this competition based on findings.
Please refer the ITT and related documentation.

INFO_ADD.P: The tendering opening committee will comprise of: authorised person from Falkirk Council Procurement and Commissioning Unit and authorised person from Falkirk Council Governance Unit.
The Selection Criteria, including but not limited to Technical & Professional Ability (ESPD 4C) and Quality.
Assurance Schemes (ESPD 4D) is outlined in the appendix ESPD documentation and in Contract Notice section titled Selection Criteria.
Suppliers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems.

Please ensure you give sufficient time to attach all required documentation for your submitted response, via Public Contracts Scotland in advance of deadline. We will not be able to accept any submissions after this deadline.

NOTE: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Public Contracts Scotland Web Site at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=525479

The buyer has indicated that it will accept electronic responses to this notice via the Postbox facility. A user guide is available at http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/sitehelp/help_guides.aspx
Suppliers are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems
A sub-contract clause has been included in this contract. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2363
Community benefits are included in this requirement. For more information see: http://www.publiccontractsscotland.gov.uk/info/InfoCentre.aspx?ID=2361
A summary of the expected community benefits has been provided as follows:
All contractors on the Framework who’s cumulative level of spend is greater than GBP 100k but less than 200k GBP will be required to provide at least twelve (No. 12) weeks of work experience.
All contractors on the Framework who’s cumulative level of spend is greater than GBP 200k but less than 500k GBP will be required to provide at least twenty-six (No. 26) weeks of training.

All contractors on the Framework will be required to provide the following Modern Apprenticeship opportunities when cumulative spend of 500k GBP and 1m GBP is reached. MA’s are to be obtained from a source agreed by the Council and the successful contractors will be required to meet with Falkirk Council’s Employment and Training Unit to discuss implementation prior to contract start. Please refer to Community Benefits Section of ITT for full details.
